title: Can true communication find beauty in chaos? The boundary of our mental landscape needs a gate.
description:
Jay is a Christian, a retired Electrical Engineer, Information Systems Designer, Business Founder and Owner, Photographic artist in training, a car and motorcycle enthusiast, interested in psychology, neuroscience and cooking. He loves the woods, he loves America, and he loves the Lord.

We talk about what causes the communication breakdown between two people of good will who are truly trying to find a way to understand and help each other to a better life?

Along the way, we talk our past histories, how an injection of chaos can beautify order, how today's cosmology affects our way of thinking.
Are the constants really constant? Getting back to first principles.
The fears produced by our cognitive dissonance that keep us from peeking over the wall.

How do we establish a set of principles that would allow people of different frameworks to communicate to bring beauty out of chaos, to interact effectively with people of differing belief systems? 

What can be learned in the wind, the water and the wilderness?
What kind of bridge can be built to connect Jordan Peterson and Sam Harris?

Are there supplements that will improve our chances against Covid?

David Berlinkski speaks at Socrates in the City
https://youtu.be/0XIDykeZplU

Jim Keller on Lex Fridman
https://youtu.be/Nb2tebYAaOA

John Vervaeke and Paul VanderKlay
https://youtu.be/1okG5kGSa6E

Dr. Schmidt supplements
https://thenutritionalhealingcenter.com/about-us/our-practitioners/darren-schmidt-d-c/
